oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Generals and Officers (1861-1866)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: H.A. Ogden created 47 illustrations of the American soldier from the Revolution to 1888 and received $100 for each work. Although the figures in the illustration are not identified by name, it is obvious that the seated figure is General U.S. Grant. The man holding the paper is General George Gordon Meade and the man alongside him is General Ambrose Burnside.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Grant, Ulysses S. (Ulysses Simpson), 1822-1885; Meade, George Gordon, 1815-1872; Burnside, Ambrose Everett, 1824-1881 Everett, 1824-1881
